metadata.title: CVE-2024-53122 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mptcp: cope racing subflow creation in mptcp_rcv_space_adjustAdditional active subflows - i.e. created by the in kernel pathmanager - are included into the subflow list before starting the3whs.A racing recvmsg() spooling data received on an already establishedsubflow would unconditionally call tcp_cleanup_rbuf() on all thecurrent subflows, potentially hitting a divide by zero error onthe newly created ones.Explicitly check that the subflow is in a suitable state beforeinvoking tcp_cleanup_rbuf().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19

No subscription required
